snippet: The Belgrade Higher Court sentenced the nine on Wednesday to suspended terms ranging from five to 10 months.
abstract: Serbian court hands down suspended prison terms to nine nationalists accused of setting fire to American Embassy during 2008 Belgrade riots; attackers were protesting United States backing of Kosovo's independence, which Serbia refuses to recognize.
lead_paragraph: The Belgrade Higher Court sentenced the nine on Wednesday to suspended terms ranging from five to 10 months.

headline.main: Serbia: Nine Get Suspended Sentences for Attacking U.S. Embassy in ’08 Riots
headline.print_headline: Europe; Serbia: Nine Get Suspended Sentences for Attacking U.S. Embassy in ’08 Riots
